articles.title: Special Information Bulletin Issued in Nepal
Stop to "UFL" Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Special Information Bulletin Issued in Nepal 
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Nepal-Korea Friendship Association issued a special information bulletin titled "The DPRK Shining as Fortress of Independence" on August 22 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 The bulletin in an article said that the founding of the DPRK was an event of weighty significance not only in shaping the destiny of the Korean people but also in accomplishing the human cause of independence.
 Under the banner of the Juche idea the DPRK has achieved independence in politics, self-sustenance in economy and self-reliance in national defence and armed the people with the idea of independence, reinforcing the independent national economy and increasing the defence capability, the article stressed.    
 In recent years the DPRK has more dynamically advanced, holding high the banner of independence despite the evermore undisguised high-handed and arbitrary practices of the U.S.-led imperialist allies, it said, adding that the DPRK is now demonstrating its might to the world as a fortress of independence and the prospect of the human cause of independence is bright thanks to the DPRK.

articles.title: Reception Hosted by Chinese Ambassador
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Maneuvers under Fire
Abolition of Outdated Cold War Structure Urged
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Maneuvers under Fire 
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean troops are staging provocative "Ulji Focus Lens-05" joint military exercises in south Korea. Involved in the "UFL" which will last till September 2 are the U.S. troops present in south Korea and huge reinforcements from the U.S. mainland and overseas and hundreds of thousands of south Korean troops.
 In this regard Minju Joson Tuesday in a signed commentary holds that if the U.S. truly wants a negotiated peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, it should stop at once its military blackmail against the DPRK.
 The gravity of the issue lies in the fact that the U.S., availing itself of the adjourned six-party talks for the settlement of the nuclear issue on the peninsula, launched the "UFL," the commentary says, and continues:    
 It is intolerable as it is an undisguised military blackmail against the DPRK. Dialogue and war exercises can never go together. It is a matter of common sense that one side should refrain from staging any military maneuver getting on the nerves of its dialogue partner or threatening it while talks are under way. The U.S., however, launched the provocative war drills aimed at invading the DPRK at a time when the six-party talks are in recess.    
 The army and people of the DPRK are now hardening their determination to deal crushing blows at the U.S., if it ignites a war of aggression against it.
 The U.S. saber rattling only indicates that it does not yet know at all who its rival is.
 It is an unpardonable treacherous act of going against the will and desire of the Korean nation that the south Korean military authorities are zealously colluding with the U.S. in its stand-off with their fellow countrymen. The south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop pursuing cooperation with the U.S. which would lead to increased dependence, not independence, but join in the nation-wide struggle for independent reunification.

articles.title: U.S. Congress Delegation Arrives
Kim Yong Nam Meets South Koreans and Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
U.S. Congress Delegation Arrives 
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of U.S. Congress headed by Chairman of the Subcommittee on Asian and the Pacific Affairs of the International Relations Committee of the House of Representatives James Leach arrived here Tuesday. 
 It was greeted at the airport by an official concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to Malaysian Prime Minister
Thai Foreign Minister and His Party Leave
articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Datuk Sri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi, prime minister of Malaysia, on the 48th national day of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand in scope in different fields, the message wished him greater success in his work.
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Malaysian counterpart Datuk Sri Syed Hamid Albar on the occasion.

articles.title: Greetings to Malaysian King
articles.content:
Thai Foreign Minister and His Party Leave
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Thai Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his party left for home Tuesday, wrapping up their DPRK visit.
 They were seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and others.
 During their four-day visit the foreign minister and his party visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.    
 They also inspected the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition, the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification and Panmunjom and enjoyed an acrobatic performance.

articles.title: Delegation of Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighters Leaves for China
articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian King
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of felicitations to Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni Al-Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail, king of Malaysia, on the 48th national day of the country.
 The message wished the friendly Malaysian people prosperity and welfare, expressing the belief that the good cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand in scope in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Delegation of Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighters Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters led by Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Ik Hyon left here Tuesday to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the world anti-fascist war scheduled in Beijing.
 It was seen off at the airport by Acting Chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Mun Jae Chol, Vice-Director of the History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea An Ok Son, Vice-Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kim Sang Ik and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

articles.title: Video Movies on National Reunification Produced
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Sri Lanka
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Public Health of the DPRK led by its Minister Kim Su Hak left here Tuesday to participate in the 23rd Southeast Asian Regional Meeting of Health Ministers of the World Health Organization (WHO) and its 58th regional meeting to be held in Sri Lanka.
 It was seen off at the airport by Choe Chang Sik, vice-minister of Public Health, and Eigil Sorensen, representative of WHO in Pyongyang.
